questions.question:
What is the measure of central tendency that 
 represents the middle value of a dataset when 
 arranged in ascending order?

Which measure of dispersion is affected the 
 least by outliers in a dataset?

In a normal distribution, approximately what percentage 
 of the data falls within one standard deviation 
 from the mean?

What statistical test is used to determine whether 
 there is a significant association between two 
 categorical variables?

Which type of sampling technique involves dividing the 
 population into non-overlapping subgroups before 
 taking a random sample from each subgroup?

What is the probability of getting exactly two 
 heads when flipping a fair coin three times?

In regression analysis, what is the term for the 
 proportion of the variation in the dependent 
 variable that is explained by the 
 independent variable?

What is the measure of association between two 
 continuous variables that ranges from -1 to 1?

Which probability distribution is used to model 
 the number of successes in a fixed number 
 of independent Bernoulli trials?

What is the term for a type of sampling bias 
 that occurs when certain members of the population 
 are systematically excluded from the sample?

What is the expected value of a discrete 
 random variable?
options: The most frequent value in the dataset
The arithmetic mean of the dataset
The square root of the variance
questions.correct_answer: The arithmetic mean of the dataset

questions.question:
What is the term for the probability of 
 observing a test result as extreme as, 
 or more extreme than, the one observed, under the 
 assumption that the null hypothesis is 
 true?

In a hypothesis test, what is the 
 probability of rejecting the null 
hypothesis when it is actually 
 true?

What type of probability distribution is 
 symmetric and bell-shaped?

What is the term for a graphical 
 representation of the relationship 
 between two continuous variables?

What is the formula for calculating the 
 standard deviation of a sample?
